isis.stitle: FULL POWER HYDRAULIC ABS BRAKE SYSTEM - REMOVE AND INSTALL - coil for CUT-OFF VALVE

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to FIGURE 70 for component location information while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks and turn key off.
Carefully clean the outside of the SAHR canister in the area of the cut-off valve.
Disconnect the electrical connector from the cut-off valve.
Remove the 3/4 inch retaining nut from the cut-off valve coil assembly.
Remove the coil assembly from the cut-off valve.
Verify that the cut-off valve core is torqued to 26 to 28 Nm (19 to 21 Lbf-ft). NOTE: Valve core may have been loosened during removal of cut-off coil retaining nut.

caution.para: In the following step do not tighten the coil retaining nut to more than 6.7 Nm (60 Lbf-in). Overtightening the nut will damage the cut-off valve core.

step1.para: Place the coil onto the cut-off valve core so that the connector is correctly positioned, and secure with the retaining nut. Tighten the nut to 5 to 6.7 Nm (44 to 60 Lbf-in).
Connect the 2 pin harness connector to the cut-off valve coil.
Connect the EZ-TECH ® to the diagnostic connector located under the center of the instrument panel. Refer to FIGURE 49 . Start the EZ-TECH ® and open the TOOLBOX™ program.

Using the EZ-TECH ® and the TOOLBOX™ program clear all brake system related inactive fault codes. If active fault codes are indicated, refer to Section 5, DIAGNOSTICS AND TROUBLESHOOTING
to make the necessary repairs .

Turn key on; then apply and release the parking brake several times to verify correct operation. Also verify that the SERVICE PARK BRAKE warning indicator did not light, and no new fault codes were generated.
Turn the key off and disconnect the EZ-TECH ® from the diagnostic connector.
